sprite.name: Goal Pole - NSMBU
sprite.notes: The thing pretty much every level ends with...

checkbox.title: Secret exit
checkbox.comment: Gives the castle and the flagpole a different texture as well.

checkbox.title: Walks off screen
checkbox.comment: There is no castle, so Mario walks off screen instead of into a castle. The effects of multiple players, Baby Yoshis and Yoshis are unknown.

checkbox.title: Snowy exit
checkbox.comment: Makes the castle laden with snow to give the level a chilly end.

sprite.name: Signboard
sprite.notes: Helps the player find the way to the end of the level, and can even have a different look to fit the level theme.

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: Thwomps are animate cinder-blocks and spike-encrusted living stones that are usually rectangular in shape and made their first appearance in the game Super Mario Bros. 3. They typically attempt to fall on and flatten or squash whoever passes below them. They can only be defeated by being touched by Mario when he is powered up with a star. It is suggested in Mario & Luigi:Partners in Time that Thwomps may in fact be born from volcanic activity.

sprite.name: Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: This sprite seems to be required for pipes to work correctly in-game. If this pipe is inside a quicksand (maybe other liquids as well) location, another pipe has to be placed directly on top of it to make the pipe show in front of the quicksand (maybe other liquids as well)...

list.title: Height-related
list.comment: For value(s) with an asterisk, 2 blocks are added to the height. Other values cause an increment of one block to the height.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
If the type is "Painted", 1 block extra is added to the height.

If the type is "Big", 2 blocks extra are added to the height.

There probably is a fourth option...

list.title: Colour
list.comment: Set the colour of your pipe! Value 3 is blue if the type is painted (or is it related to "height-related"?)

value.title: Height
value.comment: Value + 1 by default. If height-related is a value with an asterisk, the increment is 2 instead of 1. Additionally, another 2 blocks are added to the height if the type is "Big", or 1 extra block if the type is "Painted".

checkbox.title: Contains coins
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the palm tree emits 4 coins when ground-pounded on or when the player spins near it. Actually, if the last two digits of the timer are the same (133, 522, 399, etc.) it emits 8 coins instead of 4.

sprite.name: Scaredy Rat
sprite.notes: A white rat creature that first appeared in New Super Mario Bros. Wii. They appear to have black sclera, red pupils, orange feet and huge buck teeth. They slightly resemble Little Mousers. Their name is a pun on the term scaredy cat, which is a childish term for a coward.

sprite.name: Boo
sprite.notes: Boos are a type of white spherical ghost with menacing and constantly open mouths. They are known for their large tongues and small "arms" of some sort. However, the most distinctive characteristic of the Boos is their shy personality, where they cover their faces when someone looks them directly at the face. They will uncover their faces once the subject turns around.

checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boo will face to the right at first.

checkbox.title: Starts hiding
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boo won't move at first, and it will have its 'hiding' animation.

sprite.name: Big boo
sprite.notes: Also called Atomic Boos or Mega Boos, are a sub-species of Boo. Usually, they resemble and behave similarly to normal Boos, except that they are larger.

sprite.name: Goombrat
sprite.notes: Goombrats are a species of Goomba that are lighter brown, and resemble persimmons more than mushrooms. They have different facial features, and the black stems on their head are similar to tomato leaves. They also turn when they reach edges, which is similar to the behaviour of red Koopa Troopas. The enemy's name is a composition of "Goomba" and "brat". Also their teeth point down, when regular Goombas teeth point up.
